intro: Sobralia leucoxantha, commonly known as the white-flowered sobralia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. Sobralia leucoxantha is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
